intro: Daphnopsis seibertii, commonly known as the Seibert's daphnopsis, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in the Andean foothills of Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid, tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
